sentence: “While America is indeed the land of opportunity, it’s not the land of the welfare state,” Arizona Attorney General Mark Brnovich told The Washington Times.
author: Stephen Dinan
title: DHS eyes more welfare for legal immigrants as Supreme Court hears challenge

sentence: The justices heard oral arguments in an appeal by 13 Republican state attorneys general led by Arizona Attorney General Mark Brnovich of a lower court's ruling that rejected their bid to defend Trump's rule, which expanded the scope of those considered likely to become a "public charge."
author: Andrew Chung
title: U.S. Supreme Court Mulls Republican Bid To Defend Trump Immigration Rule

sentence: Justice Elena Kagan suggested to Arizona Attorney General Mark Brnovich, arguing for the group of states, that allowing the group to intervene in a case “that’s completely dead that never applied to you in the first place” is not the answer.
author: JESSICA GRESKO
title: High court wades into clash over Trump-era immigration rule

sentence: That left states that favored the public charge rule without recourse, Arizona Attorney General Mark Brnovich (R) told the justices Wednesday.
title: Supreme Court considers whether Biden administration properly ditched Trump immigration rule

sentence: Justice Elena Kagan suggested to Arizona Attorney General Mark Brnovich, arguing for the group of states, that allowing the group to intervene in a case “that’s completely dead that never applied to you in the first place” is not the answer.

title: High court wades into clash over Trump-era immigration rule
Supreme Court Weighs Whether States May Defend a Trump Immigration Policy

sentence: The justices heard oral arguments in an appeal by 13 Republican state attorneys general led by Arizona Attorney General Mark Brnovich of a lower court’s ruling that rejected their bid to defend Trump’s rule, which expanded the scope of those considered likely to become a “public charge.” Article content President Joe Biden’s administration dropped the government’s defense of the policy, prompting the action by the states.
author: Andrew Chung
title: U.S. Supreme Court mulls Republican bid to defend Trump immigration rule

sentence: Arizona Attorney General Mark Brnovich told the justices that even tacit approval of what the Biden administration did would set a precedent future presidents would abuse, using the courts to get rid of previous administration policies without going through the usual regulatory process.
author: Stephen Dinan
title: Supreme Court struggles for a solution to Biden’s handling of immigration ‘Public Charge’ rules

sentence: Justice Elena Kagan suggested to Arizona Attorney General Mark Brnovich, arguing for the group of states, that allowing the group to intervene in a case “that’s completely dead that never applied to you in the first place” is not the answer.
author: Via AP news wire
title: High court wades into clash between Biden, Republican states

sentence: Arizona Attorney General Mark Brnovich argued that Biden’s strategy is “an unprecedented legal maneuver.” Because Biden dismissed the remaining legal challenges to the public charge rule, Arizona argues that states that supported the rule were left with no recourse.
author: Jordan Dixon-Hamilton
title: Supreme Court Hears Arguments Over ‘Public Charge’ Rule

author: MJA
title: Feds Cannot Bypass States and Courts

sentence: More than a dozen Republican attorneys general, led by Arizona’s Mark Brnovich, have sought to defend the 2019 public charge rule, which broadened the definition of "public charge" to include an immigrant who receives one or more designated public benefits for more than 12 months within a 36-month period -- and included a substantial number of benefits.
author: Adam Shaw
title: SCOTUS hears GOP push to defend Trump-era public charge rule; Arizona AG calls Biden moves ‘unprecedented’

sentence: “I made a promise to Arizona voters that people who commit the ultimate crime get the ultimate punishment,” Attorney General Mark Brnovich said in a statement.
author: JACQUES BILLEAUD
title: 1st execution in Arizona in nearly 8 years set for May 11

sentence: PHOENIX (AP) — The Arizona Supreme Court on Tuesday revived a lawsuit filed by Attorney General Mark Brnovich against the board that oversees the state's three public universities over a hotel development agreement, giving him the right to try to prove the deal doesn't benefit taxpayers.
author: BOB CHRISTIE - Associated Press
title: Arizona high court revives AG's suit against ASU hotel plan
